description: Hello! I am a passionate Robotics and AI Engineer with a Ph.D. from SUTD. I love building autonomous systems that solve real-world problems. My expertise spans across navigation stack development, computer vision, and machine learning. In my free time, I enjoy participating in robotics competitions and teaching.

Education.institution: Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD)
description: Thesis Title: Towards Effective Autonomy Strategies for Outdoor Robots.

I joined the PhD program in the Faculty of Engineering Product Development, where for four years conducted research on navigation algorithms for outdoor robotic systems. These algorithms were implemented and deployed across multiple robotic platforms. The resulting work was documented and disseminated through several peer-reviewed publications authored by me in collaboration with other researchers from SUTD. Each project I was involved in was funded by Singaporean government organizations as the National Robotics Programme.
Thesis Title: Management System for University Student Services.

I enrolled in the Bachelor’s program in Informatics, where I developed intermediate to advanced programming skills in Java, JavaScript, C, and C++. Informatics is a discipline focused on how data is managed within backend systems and transformed into actionable information for decision-making in business environments and other automated software systems. For my graduation thesis, I programmed a content management system to support the administration of scholarships for international students.

description: Led a robot autonomy team for the Panthera v2.0 outdoor sweeper robot.

Developed a full navigation stack using the Robot Operating System (ROS) for the Panthera platform. Using for this C++ and Python3 and different control architectures like Behaviour Trees, Machine States, Reinforcement Learning , Genetic Algorithms and other Bio-Inspired decision making algorithms.
Achieved LTA certification in Singapore for the Panthera platform after passing the T1 CETRAN test in two different dates for two different platforms, PantheraV1 and PantheraV2.
Created a virtual robotics contest platform named Smorphi Imaginary, using the Unity engine, and a back-end programmed in NodeJS.Using for this C\#, Javascript, Typescript, HTML5,MongoDB.
Deployed the Smorphi Imaginary platform for an official contest in March 2023 at Singapore, supporting more than 200 participants simultaneously.
Developed an embodied AI framework for the Dragonfly Mosquito Catcher robot, reducing the complexity curve of deployment tasks. Using Python, chat GPT 5 official API and ROS

Engineered a Next.js and WebSockets platform for the Dragonfly robot, using Typescript, Javascript , HTML5, CSS and MongoDB for data storage that enables the robotic platform to perform scheduled path planning, video streaming, remote operation and reporting of every sensor used by the robot.
Led the publication of multiple papers in $Q_1$ journals related to AI, Machine Learning, Robotics, and Autonomy.
Supported research projects focused on robotics and automation, contributing to a body of work that resulted in multiple journal publications.
Contributed at Lionsbot developing different computer vision modules and Reinforcement Learning solutions  for their robotic platforms, using for this Tensorflow, Pytorch and Intel OpenVINO.
Contributed at Lionsbot developing different computer vision modules and Reinforcement Learning solutions  for their robotic platforms, using for this Tensorflow, Pytorch and Intel OpenVINO.
Designed and implemented firmware in C/C++ to interface hardware components with custom controller software.
Designed and implemented simulation environments for robotic platforms using Gazebo running on top of ROS1/ROS2.
Developed the backend for a blockchain-based candy machine system for NFT sales. Using the Solana blockchain.
Integrated the system to connect to users' wallets and trigger an RNG-based generator to supply image NFTs on the Solana blockchain. Using for this NodeJs, with Next and MongoDB for data storage.

Developed the backend API in Node.js for SomosOne a contest web application for breakdance performers in Mexico. contributed to the full backend API and the roster creation system for the SomosOne social platform.

Served as an instructor at the Instituto Tecnológico de Los Mochis, delivering a training course for faculty titled “Modern Prototyping Techniques: 3D Model Design Focused on 3D Printing.”. Teaching in this course how to use SolidWorks to prototype mechanical parts and the design considerations to facilitate the 3D printing process.

Developed data pipelines, inference pipelines, and training pipelines using libraries such as TensorFlow and PyTorch, deployed on cloud computing platforms including AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure. Demonstrated a strong understanding of AI governance and Model Risk Management.
